ul.li1: 1“Comfort; comfort my people,” says your God.

chapter.p: 2“Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and call to her,

ul.li1: that her compulsory labor is fulfilled, that her sin is paid for,
ul.li2: that she has receivedLiterally “taken” from the hand of Yahweh double for all her sins.”
ul.li1: 3A voice is calling in the wilderness, “Clear the way of Yahweh!
ul.li2: Make a highway smooth in the desert for our God!
ul.li1: 4Every valley shall be lifted up,
ul.li2: and every mountain and hill shall become low,
ul.li1: And the rough ground shall be like a plain,
ul.li2: and the rugged ground like a valley-plain.
ul.li1: 5And the glory of Yahweh shall be revealed,
ul.li2: and all humankindLiterally “flesh” together shall see it,

chapter.p: for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”

ul.li1: 6A voice is saying, “Call!”
ul.li2: And he said, “What shall I call?”
ul.li1: All humankindLiterally “flesh” are grass,
ul.li2: and all his loyalty is like the flowers of the field.
ul.li1: 7Grass withers; the flower withers
when the breath of Yahweh blows on it.
ul.li2: Surely the people are grass.
ul.li1: 8Grass withers; the flower withers,
ul.li2: butOr “and” the word of our God will stand forever.
ul.li1: 9Get yourselfLiterally “Go for you” up to a high mountain, Zion, bringer of good news!
ul.li2: Lift up your voice with strength, Jerusalem, bringer of good news!
ul.li1: Lift it up; you must not fear!
ul.li2: Say to the cities of Judah, “Here is your God!”
ul.li1: 10Look! The Lord Yahweh comes with strength,Literally “strong”
ul.li2: and his arm rules for him.
ul.li1: Look! His reward is with him,
ul.li2: and his recompense in his presence.Literally “before his face”
ul.li1: 11He will feed his flock like a shepherd;
ul.li2: he will gather the lambs in his arm,
ul.li1: and he will carry them in his bosom;
ul.li2: he will lead those who nurse.
ul.li1: 12Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand
ul.li2: and marked off the heavens with a span,
ul.li1: comprehended the dust of the earth in a third of a measure
ul.li2: and weighed out the mountains in the scales,Hebrew “scale” and the hills in a balance?
ul.li1: 13Who has measured up the spirit of Yahweh
ul.li2: or informed him as his counselorLiterally “the man of his counsel”?
ul.li1: 14With whom has he consulted, thatOr “and” he enlightened himOr “made him understand”
ul.li2: and taught him the path of justice,
ul.li1: and taught him knowledge,
ul.li2: and made the way of understanding known to him?
ul.li1: 15Look! The nations are like a drop from a bucket,
ul.li2: and they are counted like dust of the balances!
ul.li3: Look! He weighs the islands like a thin covering.
ul.li1: 16And Lebanon is not enough to light a fire,
ul.li2: and its animalsHebrew “animal” not enough for a burnt offering.
ul.li1: 17All the nations are like nothing before him;
ul.li2: they are counted by him asOr “from” nothing and emptiness.
ul.li1: 18And to whom will you liken God?
ul.li2: And to what likeness will you compare him?
ul.li1: 19A craftsman pours out the idol,
ul.li2: and a goldsmithLiterally “refiner” overlays it with gold,
ul.li3: and he smelts chains of silver.
ul.li1: 20The one who is too impoverished for a gift chooses wood that will not rot;
ul.li2: he seeks a skillful artisan for himself to set up an image that will not be knocked over.
ul.li1: 21Have you not known?
ul.li2: Have you not heard?
ul.li1: Has it not been told to you from the beginning?Literally “head”
ul.li2: Have you not understood from the foundation of the earth?
ul.li1: 22He is the one who sits above the circle of the earth,
ul.li2: and its inhabitants are like grasshoppers;
ul.li1: the one who stretches out the heavens like a veil
ul.li2: and spreads them out like a tent to live in,
ul.li1: 23the one who bringsOr “gives” princes to nothing;
ul.li2: he makes rulers of the earth like nothing.
ul.li1: 24Indeed, hardly are they planted; indeed, hardly are they sown;
ul.li2: indeed, hardly has their shoot taken root in the earth
ul.li1: whenOr “also” he blows on them and they wither,
ul.li2: and the tempest carries them like stubble.

chapter.p: 25“And to whom you will compare me, and am I equal?” says the holy one.

ul.li1: 26Lift your eyes up on high, and see! Who created these?
ul.li2: The one who brings out their host by number.
ul.li1: He calls all them by name.
ul.li2: Because he is great of power
ul.li3: and mighty of power, no man is missing.
ul.li1: 27WhyLiterally “To what” do you say, Jacob,
ul.li2: and you speak, Israel,
ul.li1: “My way is hidden from Yahweh,
ul.li2: and my judgment is passed over by my God?”
ul.li1: 28Have you not known,
ul.li2: or have you not heard?
ul.li1: Yahweh is the God of eternity,
ul.li2: the creator of the ends of the earth!
ul.li1: He is not faint, and he does not grow weary!
ul.li2: There is no searching his understanding.
ul.li1: 29He gives power to the weary,
ul.li2: and he increases power for the powerless.Literally “not power”
ul.li1: 30EvenOr “And” young people will be faint and grow weary,
ul.li2: and the young will stumble, exhausted.
ul.li1: 31ButOr “And” those who wait for Yahweh shall renew their strength.
ul.li2: They shall go up with wingsHebrew “wing” like eagles;
ul.li1: they shall run and not grow weary;
ul.li2: they shall walk and not be faint.
